posts.author: eltalstro
posts.content:
I'm rolling through Aielund with Brother Maynard, Pastor of the Pointy Shafts. After a brief and unsuccessful gambit as the minister of auxiliary weaponry for an inept band of knights in the service of a horseless king, Brother Maynard found himself housebound in a backwater berg within the Kingdom of Aielund. Bereft of his beloved holy hand grenade, but Bent on pushing the one true religion on the undeserving people of Aielund, Brother Maynard seizes a bow, effortlessly (and one might add all too conveniently) joins forces with another tub-thumper who is couped up in the same inn, and then chides a cloddish ranger, who sounds as if he originates from America, before recruiting him. While the wilds of Aielund prove fraught with danger and our hero lacking in accuracy, Brother Maynard's depth of wisdom of the divine, eventually prevails, guiding his arrows toward their wicked targets. 

I'd like some suggestions please :) What looks good. What looks bad? What I like is that the build is a decent archer with lots of spells and good AC. It certainly doesn't obtain the AB that Orion's Aelynthi, the Deadly  does. 
A few thoughts of my own:
  • I thought about going for thirty tumble by investing in cross-class. 
  • I like heal; I think it's valuable. Stag, you suggested once to take a pass on this. Reasons?
  • I'd like more monk but not more Paladin. Is this a sound rationale?
  • I figure that the investment into PwrAtk and 13 STR almost necessitates taking Divine shield but I'm not sure what to sacrifice.
  • I took good and protection domains partly for RP but also, stoneskin has been really helpful and divine protection has been very useful for party support.
  • I was thinking about improved crit Longbow but have opted instead for called shot. Or, should this be the feat slot to take DS? Wait, should I bother with DS? 
Also, where can you find the number of attacks per round in the CBC? 

Any comments/ suggestions appreciated.

posts.content:
I know this isn't exactly what you're looking for RP-wise, but here's Hip's Cleric/ AA for you to have a look at. If you're travelling with companions in soggy Aielund, you could probably lose Animal Domain.

Cleric/AA

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: Sorry, eltalstro, you asked about Heal. It's not that I'm opposed to the skill, rather, it's one of those "go heavy or go home" ones to my mind - always bearing in mind that I tend to play relatively skill-poor builds and can usually find more "important" skills to invest in.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
LOL, with that name, I was expecting a spear-wielding Cleric.

I have a few suggestions.  Start with STR 12 and DEX 14.  Take Blind Fight instead of Power Attack, and using the feat freed by not taking Divine Might, move Zen Archery and Weapon Focus earlier, and take Improved Crit without losing Called Shot.  Take 1 level of Fighter instead of 2 levels of Paladin, and take the 4th level of Monk at a higher level for Tumble, but for Aielund, not all the way back at level 37, which you will probably never reach anyway.
